greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of Sum_{k >= 0} 1/(4*k+3)^2.
reference: Steven R. Finch, Mathematical Constants, Cambridge University Press, 2003, Sections 1.7 Catalan's constant p. 55.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
formula: Equals Pi^2/16 - G/2, where G is Catalan's constant.

Equals zeta(2, 3/4)/16 = Psi(1, 3/4)/16, with the Hurwitz zeta function and the Trigamma function Psi(1, z), and the partial sums of the series given in the name are {A173955(n+2) / A173954(n+2)}_{n>=0}. - _Wolfdieter Lang_, Nov 14 2017
Equals Integral_{x=1..oo} log(x)/(x^4 - 1) dx. - _Amiram Eldar_, Jul 17 2020
program: (PARI) Pi^2/16 - Catalan/2 \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Jan 30 2018
(MAGMA) SetDefaultRealField(RealField(100)); R:= RealField(); (Pi(R)^2 - 8*Catalan(R))/16; // _G. C. Greubel_, Aug 24 2018
results.author: _Jean-François Alcover_, Sep 10 2014
